kaflow

Kafka streams topic processing in Python.

---`kaflow` is a simple framework that allows you to build Kafka streams processing aplications in Python with ease.Some of the features offered by `kaflow`:- Dependency Injection system inspired by [FastAPI](https://github.com/tiangolo/fastapi) and [xpresso](https://github.com/adriangb/xpresso), and backed by [di](https://github.com/adriangb/di).- Automatic deserialization of incoming messages and serialization of outgoing messages. Supports popular formats like `JSON`, `Avro` or `Protobuf`.- Message validation thanks to [pydantic](https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic).## RequirementsPython 3.8+## Installation```shellpip install kaflow```## Example```pythonfrom kaflow import Json, Kaflowfrom pydantic import BaseModelclass UserClick(BaseModel): user_id: int url: str timestamp: intapp = Kaflow(name="AwesomeKakfaApp", brokers="localhost:9092")@app.consume(topic="user_clicks", sink_topics=("user_clicks_json",))async def consume_user_clicks(message: Json[UserClick]) -> Json[UserClick]: print("user click", message) return messageapp.run()```
